source: Josh Gillies beat Cameron Belford in the visitors' goal with a fine free-kick to put the Tynesiders ahead. But Wrexham were back on level terms before half-time when Sean Newton produced an equally fine set-piece. Ryan Bowman scored a fine winner for Gateshead, though, heading Craig Baxter's cross from the right across goal and into the net. Gateshead manager Malcolm Crosby told BBC Newcastle: "To go and beat Wrexham tells me we have a decent side. "We were disappointing in the first half but you have to give Wrexham credit because they played really well. "In the first half, we didn't pass the ball well enough but in the second half, we did; that made the big difference. "You come to watch football to see goals like our second one. It was a great bit of play, a wonderful cross and a great finish." Wrexham manager Gary Mills told BBC Radio Wales Sport: "It was disappointing. We've had two or three games now when the second half has not been as good as the first. "We were too open at times in the second half... having said that we've had some good chances and we haven't stuck it in the back of the net. "They've not had a load of chances: a good free-kick for the first one and then obviously a good headers for the second one." Match ends, Gateshead 2, Wrexham 1. summary: In this passage, a football match between Gateshead and Wrexham is described. Josh Gillies scored a free-kick for Gateshead to take the lead, but Sean Newton equalized for Wrexham with a set-piece before half-time. In the second half, Ryan Bowman scored a header from a cross by Craig Baxter to give Gateshead a 2-1 lead. Malcolm Crosby, the Gateshead manager, praised his team's performance in the second half, while Gary Mills, the Wrexham manager, expressed disappointment with his team's second-half performance. The match ended with a final score of 2-1 in favor of Gateshead.

However, Wrexham equalized with a set-piece goal by Sean Newton. Gateshead's Ryan Bowman scored the winning goal with a header from a cross by Jamie Chandler, securing a 2-1 victory for Gateshead. The match saw both teams having chances, with Wrexham's Connor Jennings and Gateshead's Jimmy Phillips and Matty Pattison each winning free-kicks. The match ended with Gateshead's Ryan Bowman scoring the decisive goal.

summary: Gateshead defeated Wrexham 2-1 in a match where both teams scored from free kicks in the first half. Gateshead's Ryan Bowman scored the winning goal in the second half, heading in a cross from Jamie Chandler. Gateshead manager Malcolm Crosby praised his team's second-half performance, while Wrexham manager Gary Mills expressed disappointment with his team's second-half play.

source: Josh Gillies beat Cameron Belford in the visitors' goal with a fine free-kick to put the Tynesiders ahead. But Wrexham were back on level terms before half-time when Sean Newton produced an equally fine set-piece. Ryan Bowman scored a fine winner for Gateshead, though, heading Craig Baxter's cross from the right across goal and into the net. Gateshead manager Malcolm Crosby told BBC Newcastle: "To go and beat Wrexham tells me we have a decent side. "We were disappointing in the first half but you have to give Wrexham credit because they played really well. "In the first half, we didn't pass the ball well enough but in the second half, we did; that made the big difference. "You come to watch football to see goals like our second one. It was a great bit of play, a wonderful cross and a great finish." Wrexham manager Gary Mills told BBC Radio Wales Sport: "It was disappointing. We've had two or three games now when the second half has not been as good as the first. "We were too open at times in the second half... having said that we've had some good chances and we haven't stuck it in the back of the net. "They've not had a load of chances: a good free-kick for the first one and then obviously a good headers for the second one." Match ends, Gateshead 2, Wrexham 1. summary: Gateshead beat Wrexham 2-1 in a football match. Josh Gillies scored a free-kick to put Gateshead ahead, but Wrexham equalized with a free-kick from Sean Newton. Ryan Bowman scored the winning goal for Gateshead with a header. Gateshead manager Malcolm Crosby praised his team's performance, while Wrexham manager Gary Mills expressed disappointment.

Ryan Bowman secured the win for Gateshead with a header from Craig Baxter's cross. Gateshead's manager, Malcolm Crosby, praised his team's second-half performance and the quality of the winning goal. Wrexham's manager, Gary Mills, expressed disappointment over his team's second-half performance and missed opportunities. The match concluded with Gateshead maintaining their lead despite Wrexham's efforts.
